questions.question: The Turing test is designed to:
options: Determine machine's human ability.
Achieve artificial general intelligence.
Solve the master algorithm.
Build machines that are aware of themselves.

questions.question: The key difference between narrow intelligence and broad intelligence is best described by which of the following phrases?
options: Narrow and Broad intelligence is distinguished by complexity of algorithms.
Broad intelligence requires huge amounts of data, whereas narrow intelligence relies on minimum data.

Narrow AI can only do a certain task-and it can do it quite well, but narrow AI can't transfer its knowledge
 to different sorts of problems as with Broad AI.

Broad intelligence can extract meaning from images, whereas Narrow Intelligence is best suited for 
language processing.

questions.question: Which of the following best depict General AI?
options: A chatbot that is also connected to Tone Analyzer.
Watson Machine Learning service.
The ability to use previous experiences to come up with new creative ideas.
A system that is self-aware.

questions.question: In 1997, IBM's Deep Blue, a computer capable of analyzing 200 million moves per second defeatsworld champion
options: Brad Rutter.
Ken Jennings.
Gary Kasparov.
Lee Sedol.

questions.question: How does IBM view the impact of artificial intelligence?
options: It is here to augment human intelligence.
It is how systems predict the future.
It is about automating mundane tasks that humans do.
It is about the quest for artificial general intelligence (AGI).

questions.question: Human experts could use AI expertise to address which of the following challenges?
options: AI scales expertise to expand what is possible
AI systems have better vision
AI systems can predict our preferences
AI systems have world knowledge

questions.question: AI learning process entails human and machine activities; which of the following best depicts machine-related activities?
options: Identify the data-analytics problem
Define hyperparameters
Analyze the data provided by the model
Learns by adjusting weights and biases

questions.question: Humans have superior data gathering and learning techniques to machines, but where or when can humans use some augmented help?
options: When there is endless relevant newly published data, such that is impossible to know all of it at all times
When humans try to make in-depth if-then statements in minimum and optimized time
When there are many variables at play
All of the above

questions.question: Which of the following best describes the difference between AI, Machine Learning, and Deep Learning?
options: Each level is differentiated by specific algorithms that power the system.
They are synonyms for the same approach for the field of artificial intelligence.
Deep Learning is a subset of Machine Learning, which in turn is a subset of artificial intelligence.
Machine Learning is a subset of Deep Learning, which in turn is a subset of artificial intelligence.

questions.question: Which of the following learning methods is predominantly used with self-driving cars?
options: Supervised learning
Unsupervised learning
Reinforcement learning
None of the above because self-driving cars use Broad AI

questions.question: There seems to be a common consensus as to when was AI born, which of the following matches that consensus?
options: When Alan Turing published the paper Computing Machinery and Intelligence.
In 1943 when Warren McCulloch and Walter Pitts, researchers from the University of Chicago, propose the 'nerve net.'
In 1956 at Dartmouth College summer workshop with top scientists.
In 1957 when Frank Rosenblatt first demonstrated the Perceptron on an IBM 704 before building a custom machine.

questions.question: Which of the following best depicts or exemplifies Broad AI?
options: A self-driving car, which happens to be a collection of narrow AI technologies.

A system that supports engineers who work on complex maintenance tasks on a platform 
in the middle of the Atlantic Ocean.

A system within a bank that analyzes the balance sheet of corporate customers to recommend 
the best currency hedging strategy.
All of the above

questions.question: In 1992, IBM researcher Gerald Tesauro creates a self-teaching neural net that learns to play
options: Chess
Go game
Backgammon
Checkers

questions.question: In 2006, Hinton and colleagues demonstrate that networks with many layers can be effectively trained.
options: A single perceptron
Deep learning
Support vector machines
Linear regression

questions.question: In 1950, Alan Turing publishes the paper 'Computing Machinery and Intelligence' introducing the
options: Space X prize
Nobel Prize
Turing Test
First paper on artificial intelligence

questions.question: In 2011, IBM makes international headlines when their system appears on Jeopardy! and wins. What was the underlying architecture of the system?
options: It was founded on Unstructured Information Management Architecture (UIMA).
It was powered by advanced neural networks.
It used a brute force search engine.
It had access to the Internet.

questions.question: If you had to break down cognition and how it works in four words, what would they be?
options: Observe, interpret, evaluate, and decide
Collect data, build models, test, deploy
Observe, measure, build, interpret
Gather data, build patterns, memorize patterns, recall

questions.question: AI enables a partnership between humans and technology. Which of the following is best performed by technology and machines rather than humans?
options: Pattern identification
Imagination
Abstraction
Dilemmas

questions.question: Think of a question-answer scenario, in which of the following is easy for humans but difficult for machines?
options: Humans understand the question but may not have all the answers.
Machines are aware of all possible questions but have a hard time retrieving the answer.
Both machines and humans have a hard time understanding questions and answers.
Humans have no shortcomings that machines can tackle easily.

questions.question: [Select all that apply] Machine Learning tasks are typically classified into which of the following broad categories?
options: Hybrid learning
Supervised learning
Unsupervised learning
Reinforcement learning
